304	                    " also",
305	                    " incorporates useful features from the Korn and C shells (ksh"
306	                    " and csh).",
307	                    " .",
308	                    " Bash is ultimately intended to be a conformant implementation"
309	                    " of the",
310	                    " IEEE POSIX Shell and Tools specification (IEEE Working Group"
311	                    " 1003.2).",
312	                    " .",
313	                    " The Programmable Completion Code, by Ian Macdonald, is now"
314	                    " found in",
315	                    " the bash-completion package.",
316	                    "",
317	                    "*/~^\\*",  # pylint: disable=W1401
318	                ]
319	            ),
320	        }
321	    )
322	
323	    with patch.dict(dpkg.__salt__, {"cmd.run_all": mock}), patch.dict(
324	        dpkg.__grains__, {"os": "Ubuntu", "osrelease_info": (18, 4)}
325	    ), patch("salt.utils.path.which", MagicMock(return_value=False)), patch(
326	        "os.path.exists", MagicMock(return_value=False)
327	    ), patch(
328	        "os.path.getmtime", MagicMock(return_value=1560199259.0)
329	    ):
330	        assert dpkg.info("bash") == {
331	            "bash": {
332	                "architecture": "amd64",
333	                "description": os.linesep.join(
334	                    [

365	
366	def test_get_pkg_license():
367	    """
368	    Test _get_pkg_license for ignore errors on reading license from copyright files
369	    """
370	    license_read_mock = mock_open(read_data="")
371	    with patch.object(os.path, "exists", MagicMock(return_value=True)), patch(
372	        "salt.utils.files.fopen", license_read_mock
373	    ):
374	        dpkg._get_pkg_license("bash")
375	
376	        assert license_read_mock.calls[0].args[0] == "/usr/share/doc/bash/copyright"
377	        assert license_read_mock.calls[0].kwargs["errors"] == "ignore"

186	@pytest.fixture
187	def configure_loader_modules():
188	    return {imgadm: {}}
189	
190	
191	def test_parse_image_meta_orphan(image_orphan):
192	    """
193	    Test the internal _parse_image_meta methode
194	    Feed it an 'orphan' image as we get it from from imgadm list -j
195	    """
196	    ret = {"Error": "This looks like an orphaned image, image payload was invalid."}
197	    assert _parse_image_meta(image_orphan, True) == ret
198	
199	
200	def test_parse_image_meta_native(image_native):
201	    """
202	    Test the internal _parse_image_meta methode
203	    Feed it an 'native' image as we get it from from imgadm list -j
204	    """
205	    ret = {
206	        "description": ("A SmartOS image pre-configured for building pkgsrc packages."),
207	        "name": "pkgbuild",
208	        "os": "smartos",
209	        "published": "2018-04-09T08:25:52Z",
210	        "source": "https://images.joyent.com",
211	        "version": "18.1.0",
212	    }
213	    assert _parse_image_meta(image_native, True) == ret
